page.title: 01REVIEW : BLOCK 0592 0162
page.content: The area, which is mainly agricul- tural, is bisected by the A2 road. In- cluded within the block are Murston on the eastern fringe of Sittingbourne, the village of Bapchild astride the A2 and Teynham, a larger village lying between the A2 and the London to Dover railway which runs parallel to the main road a kilometre to the north. Lower Road is a locally-used alternat- ive route between Sittingbourne and Faversham. In Victorian times brickmaking was an important industry in the area but the brickearth has now been largely worked out and the former brickfields have been replanted with the apple, pear and cherry orchards for which this part of Kent is famous. Some arable crops such as potatoes are also grown as are soft fruits. Sheep are grazed particularly on lowlying pasture near the Swale.
